comments.html:
Ivan, I'm not sure I see this the same way you do. To me it seems pretty tactical and doesn't indicate anything in the way of a change in direction. I see it more as a specific use case of the more general problem they're trying to address.

They've got an OpenFlow controller. OVS supports OpenFlow. Virtual (compute) environments like this are relatively isolated and independent so, by comparison, much simpler to deploy (i.e. no h/w open flow devices). That combined with the well known pain that goes along with networking virtualized environments, this seems like a no brainer.
comments.name: Chris Marino
